author: Special Correspondent
text:
Mock polling in 2,396 electronic voting machines (EVMs) to be used for seven Assembly constituencies in Virudhunagar district was held in the presence of representatives of recognised political parties here on Wednesday.

In a statement, Collector V. Rajaraman said that the 2,396 ballot units and control units were brought from Gujarat. Engineers from BEL, Bengaluru, had tested the EVMs and erased the older records from them. The process of first-level test that began on February 18 was completed on Wednesday.

Following this, the mock polling of the EVMs was carried out, and the EVMs were stocked in Ramanathapuram Regulatory Market complex. Closed-circuit television cameras had been installed in and around the sealed hall. Round-the-clock security had been provided at the venue, and the hall was being monitored by officials.

District Revenue Officer C. Muthukumaran and Tahsildar (Elections) Sridhar were present.
title: Mock poll using EVMs held in Virudhunagar
